intro: Calonema beaugleholei, commonly known as the Beauglehole's calonema, is a rare and unique species native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and diverse growth forms. The plant typically grows as a succulent shrub, with fleshy, often blue-green leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. Its flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters at the tips of the stems. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Calonema beaugleholei is considered a vulnerable species.
